abstracts.cdata!:
The Basic Education Development Project
            for Yemen development objective is to: (1) increase
            enrollment of children in basic education, with particular
            attention to gender equity, in 10 governorates; (2) improve
            quality of teaching in basic education nationally, and (3)
            establish foundations for improved Ministry of Education
            (MoE) capacity to carry out its core functions, so as to
            contribute to the National Basic Education Development
            Strategy (NBEDS) goals. This restructuring paper seeks
            approval of the Regional Vice President to introduce changes
            to the Project, following the Aide Memoire of June 5, 2012.
            These changes include: (i) an extension of the closing date
            of the Project and the multi-donor trust fund (MDTF)
            financing the Project; (ii) a reallocation of the proceeds
            of both the International Development Agency (IDA) Credit
            and the Multi-Donor Trust Fund (MDTF); and (ii) changes to
            the results framework. In addition, the Borrower notified
            the Bank, as per the Aide Memoire signed on June 5, 2012, of
            a partial cancellation of funds from the Credit in the
            amount of SDR 5,089,230 (US$7.7 million equivalent).
